Creating a calculation profile
The calculation profile allows you to calculate the methodology using the system parameters specified (reporting date, dynamics type, etc.). The required data is specified once when creating the profile and can be edited if necessary.
This profile is implemented by the type "
Calculation Module. Calculation profile
" (and its child types). The profile can be created, edited and deleted from the registry of the corresponding types. The calculation profile can also be copied and edited.
To create a calculation profile, you need to:
1. Create a calculation profile. Click the
button on the control panel for the profile registry. The System will display a form to enter the profile parameters.
Note: the administrator can independently configure the visualization of the profile of any type of the System object (for more information, refer to
Configuring the visual
).
2. Enter parameters for methodology calculation where mandatory fields (attributes) are:
Setting
Purpose
Reporting date
Entering the calculation date. That is, the calculation result will be saved on this date.
Relevance date
Selecting a date to take into account the value of time-dependent attributes (
see more
about them).
Methodology
Choosing/entering the methodology according to which the calculation is performed.
A characteristic feature of the calculation profile is that there are system attributes, that allow you to calculate and save the values obtained.
Setting
Purpose
Temporary calculation result [UUID]
The attribute allows you to see the result of the methodology calculation without saving it to the database.
Saved calculation result
A system attribute that allows you to save the result of the performed calculation to the database.
3. Click
in the object window to save the parameters entered.
Note: The calculation profile is used to run the methodology and can be specified as a base object type in the corresponding algorithms. In case of starting methodologies from other object profiles, you need to make sure that the mandatory nature of the required attributes is taken into account for the correct calculation.
